thread.title: Malachy Tallack; around the world in search of home
thread.title_full: Malachy Tallack; around the world in search of home

title: Malachy Tallack; around the world in search of home
text:
Malachy Tallack; around the world in search of home Share Download (23.11 MB) MP3 available 23.11 MB 
The wind-whipped Shetland Islands in northern Scotland sit on the sixtieth parallel, the map grid line that runs around the top of the earth. 
Writer and singer songwriter Malachy Tallack was raised in the Shetlands, and one day he decided to explore this latitude. 
It took him through Greenland, Canada, Siberia and St Petersburg, before returning to the Shetlands. 
For Malachy, it was a roundabout way of finding his way home after the sudden loss of his father. 
Further information: 
60 Degrees North: Around the World in Search of Home is published by NewSouth. 
Malachy's latest book is called The Un-Discovered Islands (NewSouth) 
Events: 
Avid Reader, Brisbane, 28 February, 6 for 6.30pm start. Maleny Outspoken, 1 March, 6 for 6.30pm.
